intro: Hedyotis schlechtendahliana f. glauca, commonly known as the glaucous inchplant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and glossy, waxy leaves that give it its distinctive glaucous appearance. The plant is native to tropical regions of Central and South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
